subject: Don't handle DRI2 events on emulator
commitMessage:
Don't handle DRI2 events on emulator

XESetWireToEvent/XESetEventToWire can only set one event handler for
a particular event. When libdri2 is used together with OpenGL on
emulator all DRI2 events will go either to libdri2 or OpenGL whatever
connects to DRI2 protocol last. OpenGL needs to handle all DRI2 events
and libdri2 just skips them, so it's reasonable to not handle
DRI2 events in libdri2 at all on emulator

Change-Id: I854a42625465a7c649955673342931087623a799
Signed-off-by: Stanislav Vorobiov <s.vorobiov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Jinhyung Jo <jinhyung.jo@samsung.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Yes, in emulator's EGL I do set these, but the problem is that if some application uses libdri2 directly then it also sets these, thus, events are being swallowed and emulator EGL doesn't receive them. It's not possible to work around this without changing libdri2

Patch Set 1:

One such example is uifw which first initializes EGL, thus, emulator EGL registers handlers via XESetWireToEvent/XESetEventToWire and then uifw calls DRI2Connect on the same display, that triggers
XESetWireToEvent/XESetEventToWire calls from libdri2, thus, overriding those set in emulator EGL.

Patch Set 1:

Ok, I'll describe in more detail.
Emulator OpenGL WANTS DRI2 events, that's why it can't use tizen's libdri2, since tizen's libdri2 just swallows DRI2 events. For this reason emulator OpenGL uses its own dri2 wrapper for dri2 protocol, the similar thing is done in mesa - see mesa/src/glx/dri2.c.
Suppose some app uses both libdri2 and OpenGL, so here's what happens:
1. app calls eglGetDisplay(x_dpy) - this internally calls DRI2QueryVersion on x_dpy and sets event handlers.
2. Now, app wants to use libdri2, so the typical call
sequence is:
DRI2QueryExtension(x_dpy)
DRI2QueryVersion(x_dpy)
...
And here DRI2QueryVersion sets event handlers
again to dummy functions that just swallow DRI2 events.
Thus, after this, OpenGL won't receive any DRI2 events.

I mistakenly specified that uifw acts like this, it's not uifw, it's ecore - ecore/src/lib/ecore_x/xlib/ecore_x_vsync.c
And there may be other clients as well.

Patch Set 1:

Thanks. BTW, here - https://github.com/robclark/libdri2/blob/master/include/X11/extensions/dri2.h is a slightly modified libdri2 variant that actually solves (partially) this design drawback - it allows passing callbacks via DRI2EventOps. This still requires that multiple users of DRI2 withing a single process are aware of each other, but it's better than nothing. IMHO an event better approach would be to keep a list of DRI2EventOps instead of just a single DRI2EventOps, that would allow many event listeners
